headers.subject: RE: [opennms-discuss] Problem with rescan
headers.received: from Unknown [172.16.140.44] by tamarisk.orcom.com - SurfControl E-mail Filter (4.5); Tuesday, 22 July 2003, 07:54:56
by DOUGLASFIR.orcom.com with Internet Mail Service (5.5.2655.55) id <PLWNTXC6>; Tue, 22 Jul 2003 08:06:58 -0700

body.para: I believe this is a known problem. A rescan does not correct it. You will need to use send-event.pl to send a node up or interface up event to clear it. I've written a script to do this. Here is a portion of the script:

3) EVENTTYPE="NodeRegainedService" UEI="uei.opennms.org/nodes/nodeRegainedService" echo -e "\n" psql -q opennms postgres -f $SVCCMD read -p "For which service (e.g. HTTP)? " SERVICE /opt/OpenNMS/bin/send-event.pl $UEI -n $NODEID -i $IPADDR -s $SERVICE -x 2 ;;

quote.quotepara: -----Original Message----- From: izabaleta@ejie.es [mailto:izabaleta@ejie.es] Sent: Tuesday, July 22, 2003 3:04 AM To: discuss@opennms.org Subject: [opennms-discuss] Problem with rescan
I have some nodes in <http://10.200.40.55:8080/opennms/outage/current.jsp> Nodes with Outages. But I ping them and response me. So they are alive.
I force to rescan the node and I get the node down.
